chapter.title: Description of raw images
chapter.para: &slema; raw images are delivered for the x86_64 architecture (an image with an RT kernel is available), IBM zSeries (an image for the KVM host, and images to be used with FBA or DASD devices), and also AArch64.

These images are intended to be configured on the first boot by using either Ignition or Combustion. To detect the first boot, each image contains a flag file that is recognized by the boot loader. For more information, see .
Each image has the default mounted subvolumes as described in . The procedure for deploying these images is described in .

sect1.title: Default partitioning
sect1.para: The raw images are delivered with a default partitioning scheme, which can be changed during the first boot by using Ignition or Combustion. For the procedure to repartition the system, refer to or .

important.title: Btrfs is mandatory for the root file system.
important.para: Bear in mind that if you intend to perform any changes to the default partitioning scheme, the root file system must be Btrfs.

The images also have subvolumes mounted for booting by default. The specific subvolumes differ according to the architecture.

sect1.title: First boot detection
sect1.para: The configuration runs on the first boot only, and to distinquish between the first and subsequent boots, the flag file /boot/ignition.firstboot is used. If this file is detected, the attribute ignition.firstboot is passed to the kernel command line, which triggers creating an initramfs with Ignition or running the dracut module in the case of Combustion. After completing the configuration on the first boot, the /boot/ignition.firstboot file is deleted.
